item.title: Deadzone: Rogue - Zone 4 Apophis Release Date Exclusive
item.content:encoded:
The Zone 4: Apophis Content Update for Deadzone: Rogue is launching on December 17

Roguelite FPS Deadzone: Rogue just got a release date for its newest free DLC, Zone 4 - Apophis. It will add new missions and story to the game, along with new enemies and encounters, more weapons, as well as adding extra systems, elements, perks, and augments. The Zone 4: Apophis Content Update for Deadzone: Rogue is launching on December 17, and as an added bonus that date also marks the start of a free-to-play access period if you haven't had a chance to jump in yet.

Deadzone: Rogue was officially released in August this year on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, and is currently rocking a Very Positive ranking on Steam. You can play solo or with co-op team of up to 3 players, and puts you on board the colony ship ISS-X, which is unfortunately also home to facing murderous robots and mutants. Ain't that always the way?

It's the work of indie studio Prophecy Games, which was original part of the Hi-Rez Studios group but went solo in 2020. It's other game is Tribes 3: Rivals, a team-based first person shooter.

Rachel Weber is the Senior Editorial Director of Games at IGN and an elder millennial. She's been a professional nerd since 2006 when she got her start on Official PlayStation Magazine in the UK, and has since worked for GamesIndustry.Biz, Rolling Stone and GamesRadar. She loves horror, horror movies, horror games, and French Bulldogs. Those extra wrinkles on her face are thanks to going time blind and staying up too late finishing every sidequest in RPGs like Fallout and Witcher 3.

In This Article

item.title: The Game Awards 2025: Everything Announced So Far (Updating Live)
item.content:encoded:
The biggest show in the world of gaming is back again tonight, December 11.

The Game Awards is back again to end this year with a celebration of the best games of 2025 and an exciting look into the future. While we may not know all the surprises in store for us this year, we do know we will be covering everything live and gathering it right here for you.

This article will be the place to catch all the biggest reveals, trailers, gameplay, shocking moments, and more, and we'll be updating it as it happens, so be sure to keep checking back!

Pragmata Gets Release Date, Demo, and Will Come to Nintendo Switch 2

Capcom's Pragmata is officially coming out on April 24, 2026, and The Game Awards also revealed it will have a gameplay demo out today and that it will also be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 alongside PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S.

Mario + Rabbids Creator Davide Soliani Announces New Platforming Game Bradley the Badger

Davide Soliani, the lead creator of the Mario + Rabbids games, stopped by The Game Awards to reveal his new platforming game, Bradley the Badger. This game is a classic platforming one with fresh twists and a meta-feeling story that is helping this video game mascot through its creator's unfinished work.

There were also some fun nods to Bloodborne, Cyberpunk 2077, The Last of Us, and more.

Stupid Never Dies Is Set in a World Where Monsters Are Part of Everyday Life And You Are a Lowly Zombie

Stupid Never Dies is set in a world where monsters are part of everyday life, and you take on the role of Davy, a lowly zombie who must brave a dungeon to bring back Julia, a frozen human he loved.

The Free Shepherd Kicks Off The Game Awards

An adorable game about a dog herding sheep called The Free Shepherd kicked off The Game Awards, but it's not coming out until 2027.

Decrepit Is a Terrifying First-Person Souls-Like Coming to PC in 2026

Get a new look at Decrepit, a terrifying first-person souls-like that is headed to PC in 2026. In this game, every death drags you back to the dungeons below, and you have to start fresh apart form the knowledge you gain from each escape attempt.

Audio Mech Gets a New Gameplay Trailer and a Demo Tomorrow

Your music powers Audio Mech, a new rhythm game from the creator of Audio Surf, and it lets you use such weapons as Bass Blade, Vocal Cannon, Treble Bombs, and more. Your music is your partner, and you can bring your own music into the game. Oh, and there is a demo out tomorrow.

Guild Wars 2 - Visions of Eternity Expansion Gets a New Trailer

Guild Wars is celebrating 20 years and the launch of its sixth expansion - Visions of Eternity - and this trailer is here to remind you of how much Guild Wars 2 has grown and what you can expect from this latest expansion.

Solasta 2 - Official Early Access Release Date Trailer

Solasta 2 is entering Early Access on March 12, 2026, and you can check out a look at the game right here. For those unfamiliar, Solasta 2 is a a turn-based RPG sequel based on tabletop RPG systems, and it features such talent as Amelia Tyler (Baldur's Gate III, Hades II) as Shadwyn, Ben Starr (Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, Final Fantasy XVI) as Rickard Colwall, Devora Wilde (Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, Baldur's Gate III) as Deorcas Colwall, and Ellen Thomas (Arcane) as Anabasia.

Developing...
